text: [Music]
here at in hebrew med we've been
collecting high quality cancer tissues
for over 20 years with the main goal of
pushing for precision medicine
approaches within oncology to be able to
get a deep dive into the cancer
patient's biology we use technologies
that produce high content data and this
data arrives in batches and so we really
need scalable compute to be able to take
this data which is very difficult to
interpret for humans and turn that into
things that we can then analyze and it's
really the challenge of this batch
process large volume and scalable
compute that we wanted to address using
aws's cloud infrastructure what we built
with aws is a scalable compute cluster
um using kubernetes controlled spot
instances to be able to start up the and
the processing on command and to be able
to then process all of the samples in an
efficient time as possible and get the
data into our database for further
analysis what the aws infrastructure has
allowed us to do is to really get the
processing as efficient as possible this
has actually allowed us to grow the
multi-ohmic cancer database that we have
and in as low cost as possible this
really helps the customers in that we
can actually have a larger data set in
which to gain deeper biological insights
the high efficiency of the aws setup
that we now have allows us to grow the
database efficiently this allows us to
not only deliver the patient's data back
to the hospitals but also in
collaboration with our partners push
forward precision medicine approaches
and really undertake therapeutic
development with the end goal of helping
the patients now that we have our aws
infrastructure established we can really
push forward with doing different types
of analyses and different types of
processing steps on the biological data
that we have this is really going to
allow us to flexibly look into the data
to push forward precision medicine
approaches
